page.title: 07The Fosseway.
page.content:
{THE FOSSEWAY
The Roman Fosse Way runs through the south-east of our area.Our modern roads are built on top of the old Roman one but there is a part which is now buried beneath farmland.Romans built straight roads with solid foundations.They were paved and used by soldiers for marching from one area to another.Many archaeoligists have searched in our area along the route of the Fosse Way and have found remains of jars and coins. There is evidence that there is another Roman road running from west to east in the north of our area,and then on to the Roman "resort"at Bath. There is a public footpath over the old route which crosses Dutchy of Cornwall land in our area.
